@graph.caption: Jackfruit Chilorio is a popular recipe from the state of Sinaloa. It is traditionally made with pork, but this version uses jackfruit instead

@graph.name: Slow Cooker Jackfruit Chilorio « Dora's Table
@graph.description: Jackfruit Chilorio is a popular recipe from the state of Sinaloa. It is traditionally made with pork, but this version uses jackfruit instead

@graph.name: Dora S.
@graph.description: Dora is the founder, recipe developer, and photographer at Dora's Table and Mi Mero Mole. Born and raised in Mexico and a graduate of the Culinary Institute of America in New York, she adopted a vegan (plant-based) diet to take control of her health.

@graph.name: Slow Cooker Jackfruit Chilorio
@graph.description: Chilorio is traditionally made with pork, but for a vegan version jackfruit replaces the meat.
recipeIngredient: 2  (20 oz) cans Green Jackfruit in Brine, rinsed and drained

recipeInstructions.text: In a small saucepan, add the chiles and cover with the water. Bring to a boil and then turn off the heat. Cover and let the chiles rehydrate for 10-15 minutes. Reserve ½ cup of the chile cooking liquid.
recipeInstructions.name: In a small saucepan, add the chiles and cover with the water. Bring to a boil and then turn off the heat. Cover and let the chiles rehydrate for 10-15 minutes. Reserve ½ cup of the chile cooking liquid.

recipeInstructions.text: To a blender, add the chiles, ½ cup chile cooking liquid, orange juice, vinegar, onion, garlic, parsley, oregano and cumin. Blend until smooth. Season with salt and pepper.
recipeInstructions.name: To a blender, add the chiles, ½ cup chile cooking liquid, orange juice, vinegar, onion, garlic, parsley, oregano and cumin. Blend until smooth. Season with salt and pepper.

recipeInstructions.text: Add the drained jackfruit to a slow cooker. Pour the blended chile puree over the jackfruit. Stir, making sure all the jackfruit is coated in the sauce. Cook on low for 3 to 4 hours.
recipeInstructions.name: Add the drained jackfruit to a slow cooker. Pour the blended chile puree over the jackfruit. Stir, making sure all the jackfruit is coated in the sauce. Cook on low for 3 to 4 hours.

recipeInstructions.text: Using two forks, shred the jackfruit. Cook for another 30 minutes to 1 hour. Season with salt and pepper.
recipeInstructions.name: Using two forks, shred the jackfruit. Cook for another 30 minutes to 1 hour. Season with salt and pepper.

@graph.keywords: crockpot jackfruit, jackfruit chilorio, slow cooker jackfruit
